DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the treatment of a cancerous disease of the peritoneum with complete cytoreductive surgery with intraperitoneal chemohyperthermia using oxaliplatin plus irinotecan. This is a Phase II study with 100 patients. Origins of the tumors: these include colon, rectum, appendix, peritoneum, and endocrine tumors.
DOC.brief_title: Treatment of a Cancerous Disease of the Peritoneum With Complete Cytoreductive Surgery and Intraperitoneal Chemohyperthermia
DOC.criteria: Peritoneal seedings coming from colon, rectum, pseudomyxoma (appendix), peritoneum (mesothelioma and serous tumors), or endocrine tumors. No extraabdominal metastases Good general status (American Society of Anesthesiologists Physical Status score [ASA] 1 or 2) Signed consent Tumor seedings coming from other origins Huge peritoneal carcinomatosis (peritoneal score > 25, except for pseudomyxomas) Peritoneal carcinomatosis progressing rapidly Presence of extraabdominal metastases Patients presenting contraindications to the use of oxaliplatin or irinotecan
